upload_request.subject: IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Request
upload_request.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},
Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2022 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.
As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8.  
We also kindly remind you that early registration for the conference is due by September 2.  Regardless of attendance modality, one author/presenter for each work is required to register at the rates outlined on http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/registration/conference-registration.

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via Dropbox: {File Request Link}

Please follow the naming convention as described here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. 

1. Video Preview Submission. Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Dropbox link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews. 
The deadline for the video preview is August 15.

2. Paper Presentation Video Recording. All VIS papers should be accompanied by a recording of the paper presentation. Detailed instructions regarding these recordings are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via Dropbox. 
The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

3. Representative Image. As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use on the virtual website. The same paper specific Dropbox link as above should be used for uploading the representative image. Deadline is September 8.
For these 6 files, please follow the naming conventions specified in the detailed instructions page: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.
After uploading files via Dropbox, we perform various initial checks automatically. Please visit {Upload Check URL} to check the results of this test. It will also show which of the requested files have already been uploaded.

4. Author Information Form. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed. Specifically, we need information regarding (a) who will be presenting the paper, (b) if you plan in person or virtual attendance, (c) if you have posted your paper to a preprint server (and where), (d) if this publication is subject to Plan S, and (e) practitioner information.

Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/DU3zPDDrNwwFYjuB9 

Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form.  Deadline for completing the form is September 8.

5. Copyright Release. Finally, for papers that will be published in IEEE TVCG or on IEEE Xplore.  Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information.  Copyrights will be due no later than September 8.
 
Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2022 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Jian Zhao, and Katerina Vrotsou

This is a friendly reminder that your Video Preview and/or Video Preview Subtitles are 7 days overdue for submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”. The deadline for both files was August 15. As of today, one or both files have not been uploaded to your individual Dropbox folder.
Please upload the missing file(s) as soon as possible via Dropbox: {File Request Link}
The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews.
Please follow the naming convention described here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.
After uploading files via Dropbox, we perform various initial checks automatically. Please visit {Upload Check URL} to check the results of this test. It will also show which of the requested files have already been uploaded.
Common Issues
“I already uploaded my Video Preview and Video Preview Subtitles.” Your uploaded files did not register with our File Checker. The most common explanation is the file names do not match the expected format. Please follow the naming convention linked above.
“I never received instructions to submit materials.” Please check your spam for the original email on July 23, titled “IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Request” from publications@ieeevis.org. If you do not find the original email in your spam, please contact tech@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2022 Publications Chairs

Dear {Contributor(s)},

This is a friendly reminder that your Video Preview and/or Video Preview Subtitles are 7 days overdue for submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”. The deadline for both files was August 15. As of today, one or both files have not been uploaded to your individual Dropbox folder.

Please upload the missing file(s) as soon as possible via Dropbox: {File Request Link}

The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews .

Please follow the naming convention as described here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide .

Common Issues

copyright_delay.subject: VIS 2022 Publications Clarifications and Reminders
copyright_delay.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},
With this email we would like to share some information regarding your ongoing publication with submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.
In the information email regarding uploads you recently received from us, you were informed of the upcoming deadline for completing the copyright release form for your submission.
There is currently a delay from IEEE in issuing copyright releases to authors. These will be issued and sent within the coming week(s).
We would also like to inform you that the early bird registration to the conference has been extended until September 16th which is also the hotel registration deadline. Register at: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/registration/conference-registration.
Finally, please do not forget to upload your presentation video recording and representative image if you have not already done so. It is important that you name your files correctly as outlined in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide#file-uploads-and-naming-convention).

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2022 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Jian Zhao, and Katerina Vrotsou

missing_video.subject: VIS 2022 Publications Clarifications and Reminders
missing_video.body_html:
IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Check & Reminder

http://ieeevis.org/

Dear {Contributor(s)},

The automatic check of your submission {UID} entitled “{Title}” concluded that until recently there are uploads overdue or/and issues with one or several of your uploads:

{Audit Results}

You can check the current results of the test here: {Upload Check URL}.

Please upload the missing file(s) or/and fix the outlined issues via Dropbox by September 15th. Your Dropbox link is: {File Request Link}.

The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of recordings and other material are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.

Please follow the naming convention described there.

After uploading files via Dropbox, we perform various initial checks automatically. Please visit {Upload Check URL} to check the results of this test. It will also show which of the requested files have already been uploaded.

Common Issues

  • “It states that my video is missing but I already uploaded my video.” Your uploaded files did not register with our File Checker. The most common explanation is the file names do not match the expected format. Please follow the naming convention linked above. For instance, the presentation video of a submission with the exemplary id “v-full-0001” and last name “Smith” of the first author should have the file name “v-full-0001_Smith_Presentation.mp4”, the corresponding subtitles should be named “v-full-0001_Smith_Presentation.sbv” (or .srt).
  • “I never received instructions to submit materials.” Please check your spam for the original email titled “IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Request” from publications@ieeevis.org. If you do not find the original email in your spam, please contact tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2022 Tech Chairs

Alex Bock, Johannes Knittel, John Thompson, John Wenskovitch

reminder_survey.subject: VIS 2022 Reminder
reminder_survey.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},
In less than three weeks we will kick off the first hybrid IEEE VIS conference where you will present your submission {UID} entitled “{Title}”.
If you have not submitted our Google Forms sheet yet, please do so now: https://forms.gle/DU3zPDDrNwwFYjuB9.
Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form.
As a hybrid conference, we will have live presentations on-site, but also pre-recorded presentations with live Q+A over Zoom for speakers that cannot attend on-site. It is important for us to know whether you plan to present live on-site or whether you attend remotely. 
Change of plans? If your planned presentation mode has changed since you filled in this form, we kindly ask you to resubmit the form again with your data and updated attendance mode at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2022 Tech Chairs
Alex Bock, Johannes Knittel, John Thompson, John Wenskovitch
